name: Exciting Walking tour of Westminster London (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Our journey will start at Charing Cross Station and you’ll be visiting all of London’s most famous landmarks. Starting at Trafalgar Square with the National Gallery, where you’ll see just how much of Britain’s most famous paintings are religiously influenced. Then you’ll be continuing to view more main landmarks including; Leicester Square, Chinatown, St James’ Palace, and important figures of past heroes. Later at Buckingham Palace and St James’ Park, you’ll be finding out all about the complex history behind the monarchy and why their still so important today. 

I’ll show you hidden gems of this beautiful city that only a few have heard about. The rest of the tour will be spent strolling through St James’ Park, Westminster Abbey, and Parliament Square. We end our tour at the famous and grand London Eye where you can continue to go and explore more of London or enjoy some of England's finest dining; fish & chips!

Disclaimer: While not required, tips are hugely appreciated. I do this as a job, not a hobby, and the gratuity is used to fund basic needs and necessities. The standard tipping amount is around £10 per person. Please keep this in mind when booking, as the money is used to fund my basic needs and keep this tour going for you guys!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Scenic Stroll on the Southbank (Available in )
description:
The Southbank is the heart of London's cultural scene, with opportunities to experience theatre, art, and literature. There are so many beautiful things about the history of this area that you will discover, once you take this tour.

Learn more about the history of the Globe theatre, the best upcoming cultural events, and find hidden gems that you likely wouldn't find by yourself.

Intrigued? Then book my tour to find out more!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Essential London Free Tour - Westminster (Available in Spanish)
description:
Walking around the most iconic places in central London is something that no visitor can miss, but most people stay above ground and miss out on many of the things that make this part of London so important.

If you want to see familiar places like Trafalgar Square , Buckingham Palace, the Houses of Parliament or Westminster Abbey from a different point of view, this is the tour for you.

From Covent Garden to Parliament Square via The Mall, St. Jame's Park and much more, we won't leave a corner unexplored as we enter the heart of London.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Soho Tour (Available in Spanish)
description:
The free Soho tour runs through the streets of this picturesque neighborhood knowing the stories and characters that have been forging its essence. From Soho Square to China Town, and from Piccadilly Circus to Carnaby Street, a tour is framed by which we will visit the Red Light Redoubts, the bars with history of the area, talk about attacks, diseases, homosexuality and see how well-known characters like Carl Marx, Oscar Wilde or Jimi Hendrix left their mark here. It is the cradle for bohemian artists, intellectuals and writers from around the world. Come on our guruwalk and you'll never see Soho again with the same eyes.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free James Bond & the History of Espionage Tour of London (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Step into the shoes of the world’s most famous spy, as you explore Westminster and uncover some of the most iconic locations from the James Bond films, including Die Another Day, the Living Daylights, A View to a Kill, Skyfall and SPECTRE!

​

Hear about the time the Queen spent a few minutes with Bond for the 2012 Olympics! Take a few detours along the way to delve into the life of Bond’s creator, Ian Fleming, who spent the Second World War working in Naval Intelligence and built his own team of super spies along the way.

 

On the Free James Bond & The History of Espionage, you will wing by the Ministry of Defence to learn about the Secret Service’s real ‘C’, Mansfield Cumming, first director of the Secret Intelligence Service, and more in a fun, entertaining 2-hour stroll that will absolutely captivate you! 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour to discover Westminster (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
Immerse yourself in the history of the kingdom of England. Palaces, castles, kingdoms, love, betrayal, what happened at that time to those who betrayed their king. Visit the Palace of Queen Elizabeth II and discover why the English adore their queen so much. Enjoy one of the most famous attractions in London, the famous Changing of the Guard if we have the chance! Stroll through one of the most beautiful parks among the 8 royal parks, St James, known as the park of the pelicans. Be dazzled by the beauty of Westminster Abbey and discover its true history. Be amazed by the grandeur of the Parliament and discover where the Prime Ministers have lived since the 18th century and much more.

NOTE:
 - Arrive at least 10 minutes before the tour starts.

-Groups of more than 6 people must pay the guide in advance a minimum of 10 pounds per adult.

-This is a free tour, that is, a free payment tour where you value the price at the end of the visit according to the quality of the tour. We ask to consider a minimum of £10 per person, completely decent, accessible and according to London prices, and in relation to the expenses that the guide must cover to carry out the tour.

- Keep in mind that you can pay in cash or card but euros or any currency other than pounds are not accepted.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Magical Christmas Walking Tour in London (Available in )
shortDescription:
You’ll explore London’s winter transformation and end at the famous Winter Wonderland. Join these whimsical walking tours today.

Enjoy my magical Christmas themed tour filled with lots of Jolly fun! The festive season is my favourite time of year and so I want to share all the beauty London has to offer during the winter season to all of you.

I’ve noticed that so many travellers come to this great city in these cold winter months and don’t truly experience all of London’s Christmas joy; and so I have made it our mission to showcase how unforgettable and spirited a London Christmas can be.

Together you’ll explore London’s winter transformation, showing you wonderful sights, new things and paths never taken before, at the most affordable prices. Including the Regent’s colourful Christmas lights, Mayfair’s bright and bold high-class shopping district, the tour ends at the famous Winter Wonderland where you are free to go on and enjoy a new wonderful adventure. Join these whimsical walking tours today, where families and children are welcome, and see what makes London the greatest city in the world.

Key:
If the tour doesn't reach a certain amount of numbers attending the tour will be cancelled.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Sherlock Holmes Tour of London (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Few characters in literature are as intrinsically linked to a city as Sherlock Holmes is to London. Arthur Conan Doyle’s stories and the many TV and film adaptations are love letters to this city, the foggy back alleys and low-lives of London as important and distinctive as Holmes himself, so grab your deer stalker hat and join the Free Sherlock Holmes and the Art of Deduction Tour to explore many locations visited by the famous detective!

Stop at famous hotels, gentlemen’s clubs, and even London’s only Sherlock Holmes Pub. The tour will be a treat for any Holmes fan, as you’ll visit places mentioned in the original stories; 

  • The Hound of the Baskervilles
  • A Scandal in Bohemia
  • The Adventure of the Illustrious Client
  • and many more.

Don’t worry if you haven’t read the books as you will see places frequented by Benedict Cumberbatch, Robert Downie Jr, Christopher Plummer and Jeremy Brett in their screen appearances as the great sleuth.

On the Free Sherlock Holmes & the Art of Deduction Tour, you will delve a little into Conan Doyle’s life, including his friendship with Oscar Wilde and his belief in the paranormal,
among many more surprises that will leave you amazed to the core! 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Christmas in London Tour (Available in )
shortDescription:
Experience the wonder of glittering Central London up close this winter with a brand new Christmas Tour. See the dazzling light displays, the grottos, and hundreds upon hundreds of decorated Christmas Trees.

​

London can trace its first Christmas celebrations back a thousand years, but with each new generation came new traditions to join the old ones. On this tour, you will travel back to Victorian London to discover the origins of Britain’s modern Christmas celebrations, the Christmas tree, crackers, Christmas cards, the inspirations behind Charles Dickens’ A Christmas Carol and so much more.

 

You know the holiday, now learn the history!
Along the way we will stop at:  

  • Benjamin Pollock's Toy Shop
  • Duke of York's Theatre
  • St Martin's in the Field
  • Cecil Court
  • Royal Opera House
  • Trafalgar Square


And finish at Covent Garden 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Queer & LGBTQ+ History Tour of London (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Today the LGBTQ+ community’s presence can be seen across every borough and street in London. Many inequalities still exist, but the massive advances over the past 50 years have meant that most (but not all) LGBTQ+ people can now live openly and freely wherever they choose across our diverse city.

 

Hear stories of drag queens in the 1700s, the 1920’s secret gay soirées, and the infamous history of Soho, one of the world’s best loved queer neighbourhoods.

 

Join us to celebrate the iconic people and places that made this possible, and the ones who still lead the fight today, as we take pride in a community that has been through so much, from repression and persecution to violence and discrimination, yet continues to strive towards bringing equality and inclusivity to all. 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Westminster, Royal Area + Change of Guard (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
We will visit the Real Zone, the Palaces that integrate it from Buckingham to Saint James among others. We will see two changes of guard in two different areas, Buckingham and Caballeriza. We will travel through the History of one of the most famous and influential Monarchies, its news and its anecdotes, traditions and symbols. Some places of interest: - Buckingham Palace - Saint James Palace and Park - Trafalgar Square - National Gallery - British Parliament - Theaterland Area - Green Park and many other places!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Ghosts, Ghouls and Ghastly Murders Tour of London (Available in English)
shortDescription:
When night falls in the city and mist settles in the streets, London becomes a very different place.

Londoners of old rise from their slumber and the spirits of the past return to haunt the living, but its not just the dead that you need to fear. For every patriotic hero, there must be villain and London has certainly had its fair share of those.

Join us as we explore the darker side of this city, encountering the serial killers, gangsters and monsters, both malevolent and murderous who have risen from the shadows to find infamy on these streets.
Along the way we will stop at Cleopatra's Needle, Great Scotland Yard, Banqueting House, Horseguard's Parade, St James Park & Green Park.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Royal Westminster Sightseeing Tour (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Explore Westminster, one of the wealthiest Boroughs in the Western world, the political heart of Britain and the home of the Royal Family, as we take you to three palaces, the Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey (the resting place of Dickens, Darwin and hundreds more), a Royal Park, the world’s most famous clock and the changing of the Guard ceremony*. 

 

Travel through 1000 years of Britain’s past, learning the salacious history of the world’s most famous royal family, from William the Conqueror in 1066 to Queen Elizabeth II today. Hear tales of the monarchs who truly changed the world: the womanising Henry VIII, the regal Victoria, the People’s princess Diana and of course, Elizabeth II and the Windsors.

 

However, there’s more to Westminster than just the Royals. Parliament has been meeting here for 700 years and you will be regaled with tales of our greatest and most controversial leaders, from Winston Churchill to Lord Nelson and even those who fought against them, like wretched Guy Fawkes who tried to blow up Parliament.

 

This tour really is a must see for everyone new to London. Just try not to blink, because around every corner is yet another iconic landmark, that you won’t want to miss.

​

 

*We cannot guarantee the ceremony will be running every day. The schedule varies due to seasons and weather.  

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: The Original Free Tour of London (Available in English)
shortDescription:
No other tour covers so many major London landmarks! Have your cameras at the ready as we walk past Westminster Abbey and the Big Ben, and see where the Queen and Prince Charles live as we stroll past Buckingham and St. James’s Palaces. On this 3-hour free walking tour you'll tick off many of London's must-see sites.
 
 Your London Free Tour starts in front of the Apple Store in Covent Garden and finishes by Westminster Abbey.

 Around every corner is another piece of royal history on this free London walking tour!

Your expert local guide will take you to Buckingham Palace, the official residence of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II (some tours will even see the changing of the guard!), and you’ll walk past St James’s Palace, where Princes William and Harry grew up and Prince Charles still lives. You’ll also see Westminster Abbey, where the Queen was crowned, Princess Diana was farewelled, and Kate and William were married. However, it’s not only the current royals who feature on this London walking tour – you’ll also hear about other kings and queens who left their mark on Great Britain.
 
 Of course though, it’s not just the royals who helped to shape London,

the UK and indeed, the world. Your guide will tell you about Winston Churchill as you walk past the Churchill War Rooms, talk about Guy Fawkes as you stroll past the Houses of Parliament, and tell you about Admiral Nelson as you visit the Nelson Column on Trafalgar Square. With other must-see sites like Covent Garden, Horse Guards Parade and of course, the Big Ben, this London gratuity-based free walking tour shows you many of London's major landmarks.

Tour Highlights:

  • The Free Tour starts in front of the Apple Store in Covent Garden 
  • See the homes of the Queen and Prince Charles, Buckingham and St James’s Palaces respectively
  • Visit the stunning Westminster Abbey, site of royal coronations, weddings and funerals
  • Learn about Guy Fawkes and his attempt to blow up the Houses of Parliament
  • Look up at the iconic Big Ben
  • See Nelson’s Column on Trafalgar Square
  • Hear about Winston Churchill outside the Churchill War Rooms
  • Stroll down the famous Horse Guards Parade.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Sex, Drugs and Rock n Roll Tour of Soho (Available in English)
shortDescription:
Dickens described it as the place of “smoke and song”, little has changed. We call it London's home of Sex, Drugs, and Rock 'n' Roll. Soho is where you go for a good night out. It's where you go to let your hair down and be a little bit naughty. 

 

In its long and varied history, Soho has seen it all; secret meetings of the Communist Party (under Karl Marx himself), virtuoso performance by an 8 year old Mozart, the home of the world's most famous lover, Casanova, a cholera outbreak that threatened to end life in London, and of course, it's had more than its fair share of alcohol induced scandal.

See where the Beatles played their first and last gig in London, and where Beatlemania was born. Join us as we visit some of the top music venues from the 1960s that helped to launch the careers of The Who, The Rolling Stones, and many more. We will saunter into what is left of the old red light district and take a stroll down the one and only Carnaby Street, the hub of swinging 60's fashion and the birthplace of the miniskirt.

 

This tiny district has left an indelible mark on pop culture and has risen from being a seedy dangerous realm thirty years ago to becoming one of the most famous and fashionable parts of the capital today.


Tour Highlights include:​

  • The London Palladium
  • Leicester Square
  • Carnaby Street
  • Liberty​​
  • The Beatles
  • Jimi Hendrix's last gig
  • The Cholera Outbreak
  • The Old Red Light District

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Jet Boating the Thames in Central London
shortDescription: Ride the fastest speedboats on the River Thames and see London like never before in this ultimate roller coaster on water experience.
description:
Ride the fastest speed boats on the River Thames and see London like never before in this Ultimate roller coaster on water Experience. 

Feel like James Bond for the day as you Experience an extreme sightseeing RIB ride on-board the fastest London speedboats on the River Thames. See more of London in 50 minutes (approx.) than you’d expect to see in conventional sightseeing tours three times this length.

Full fun thrilling guided commentary, turbo blasting speed and Bond music included in this Thames RIB Experience Ultimate Rollercoaster on water.

Enjoy one of the most popular Thames RIB Experiences with this 50 minute round trips from Embankment Pier in Central London. This thrilling Experience is jam packed with a fun & gripping live commentary as we pass by London’s greatest new & historical sights and has enough hair raising high speed to tip your heart rate off the scale. 

Start snapping, as we pass by Big Ben, the Houses of Parliament, MI5, MI6, The London Eye, St Paul's Cathedral, Shakespeare's Globe Theatre, Monument, the Shard, HMS Belfast, Tower Bridge and the Tower of London.

You’ll return to Embankment Pier totally buzzing in the aftermath of the most exciting 50 minutes of your life!

name: Free Tour of the Royal Zone and the Palaces! (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
Coming to London and not enjoying the area of Palaces, Stables, Powers and when possible, Changing of the Guard, is not coming to London! We will travel through the History of one of the most famous and influential Monarchies, its current situation and its anecdotes, traditions and symbols.
Some places of interest:

  • Buckingham Palace
  • Saint James Palace and Park
  • trafalgar square
  • National Gallery
  • British Parliament, Big Ben
  • Theaterland Zone
  • stables
  • Prime Minister's House
  • and many more sites!

description:

name: Parliament, Parks and Palaces Free Walking Tour (Available in )
description:
A perfect tour to introduce yourself to Westminster and orientation  of the city, or if your short of time a great way to tick off many of the main sites from your list or to find things you may wish to explore in detail later.

WESTMINSTER-A living breathing constantly evolving city home to over a quarter of a million people, but recognised by the entire World. It’s home to some of London and The planets most iconic and important landmarks Westminster Abbey, “Big Ben” 10 Downing Street and even Buckingham Palace itself.

On this FREE (Pay what you like) tour I will take you to the hot spots and delve a little deeper into some of the sights of Westminster and try and give a sense of this places wider impact and it’s place in modern day London.

3 Palaces, 2 Parks and “The mother of all Parliament’s”

PLUS! this tour will take you to see the mounted regiments of The Household Cavalry. “The Horseguards” to watch the century old “punishment ceremony”* (3.15 tour ONLY if available) and get that iconic London photo with a guard in full regalia. 

Starting opposite Westminster  station this fully guided tour in English will take in

  • Westminster Abbey 
  • “Big Ben”
  • Buckingham Palace
  • St James’s Palace
  • The Palace of Westminster (Houses of Parliament)
  • Downing Street
  • Horseguards Parade
  • Solider photo op (depending on availability)
  • St James Park
  • Green Park 
  • And much much more…



 Our guide Richard was informative, entertaining and ensured we all had a good time and we had time to take photos - a great experience from start to finish!”

“The walking tour was the highlight for me though. Richard was an exceptional tour guide, he went above and beyond to introduce me to London and was very knowledgable.”

These are just a couple of reviews from just a few of the thousands of happy visitors to London that I have had the pleasure of guiding over the past 20 years. But don’t just take their word for it join me yourselves on this 2 hour walking tour of some of The Worlds most famous places.

📃THE BASICS📃- What you need to know! (And the boring legal bit)
📍The Tour Starts at the statue of Sir Winston Churchill in Parliament Square opposite  Westminster Station.  I will be wearing a cap and carrying a small backpack as well as holding a sign reading “Guru Tours London”

📍The tour ends at Green Park station, ideal for underground links to Westminster, Kensington, Victoria or a short walk to Piccadilly Circus, Leicester Square, Soho and Chinatown or Hyde Park

The route is flat on either paved roads or for some sections on a gravel path/courtyard. The route is suitable for those with reduced mobility, A comfortable pair of shoes or trainers is sufficient,  no need for any specific footwear, although it is advised against wearing high heels (sorry Gentleman!!!)

🐕‍🦺The tour is suitable for dogs but they MUST be kept on a lead at all times.

🥤🥪Please note that there are some Toilet facilities and refreshments on this tour but they are limited  and charge a small fee to use them. You may eat and drink on the tour (please no alcohol) please be responsible and take any rubbish with you until you can find a bin. Smoking and vaping is forbidden on this tour for the comfort of all participants. We reserve the right to not allow or remove any person who I believe is acting inappropriately or under the influence of alcohol or other substances.

👉💉Just for the record I am fully vaccinated against Covid as per the current Uk government recommendations, hold a current first aid certificate from the British Red Cross (valid until January 2024) plus advanced DBS (child and vulnerable peoples) certification.

👉During this tour we will come across many wild birds such as Swans, Geese pelicans and other water fowl as well as horses and other animals. I ask all visitors to exercise caution when around these animals please do not feed them as they may bite. We advise that all participants are responsible for their own safety at all times. And follow and instructions given by either myself a police officer or anyone else in a position of authority.

🎒Please take basic precautions with your personal belongings as pickpockets  may operate in this area. All participants are responsible for any personal possessions. Either the guide or Guru walks does not accept any liability for any personal injury or damage or loss of property

📩 If you have any questions please feel free to contact me via the tour guru website

I look forward to welcoming you to London

⌚Total tour time Approx 2hrs 

Meeting point: Sir Winston Churchill Statue-Parliament Square

name: Free Tour in London (Available in English)
description:
London is undoubtedly one of the most picturesque cities in the world to explore. Join us on an enchanting stroll through London as we visit the major sights that one really shouldn’t miss in this beautiful city.
Free walking tour of London offers you a complete introduction to the city. You will hear interesting facts about the city you wouldn’t notice walking around by yourself. In a nutshell, you are invited to spend an unforgettable time in London. Booking is completely free, fast, and easy. Why don’t you join us?
During Free Tour in London, you can learn about the most influential royal family of the world, listen to the stories of the famous King Henry VIII, and hear out the failed conspiracy of Guy Fawkes to explode the Parliament. You will also have the opportunity to get a closer look at Sir Winston Churchill’s life in front of his war rooms. Other important figures from British histories, such as Queen Victoria, Newton, Admiral Nelson, Princess Diana, or Duke of Wellington will be protagonists of the incredible stories our guides will tell you. 

On the Free Walking Tour of  London, many spectacular sites will be at your disposal to be admired. You are invited to go back to the past stepping on the places in which many events were staged. You will realize how this rainy island became the biggest empire of mankind. Touring the city of Westminster, you will visit three royal palaces i.e., Buckingham Palace, St. James’s Palace, and Westminster. Some of the iconic buildings and monuments that you will see are Big Ben, the Houses of Parliament, Anthenium, King George VI and Queen Elizabeth Memorial, and the London Eye.  

 

In this free tour we will visit: 

  • Piccadilly Square
  • Leicester Square 
  • Trafalgar Square 
  • Buckingham Palace
  • St. James’s Palace
  • The Mall
  • Churchill War Rooms 
  • St. James’s Park
  • Parliament Square
  • The Houses of Parliament
  • Westminster Abbey 
  • The Big Ben
  • London Eye

name: Free Walking Tour London by Night - Between the city lights! (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
Please read ALL information BEFORE booking.


There is no city with the nightlife vibe of London. And the lit streets. And the street party that mixes a Hare Krishna parade with Soho clubgoers and passing travelers. Do not miss touring the most beautiful area of London illuminated when sunset and dusk falls. In a city that never sleeps and always vibrates, you can also come to experience it in person.
Some places:

  • Carnaby Street in Soho
  • Theaterland
  • Chinatown
  • Piccadilly
  • Beatles and Jimi Hendrix locations
  • Seven Dials
  • Neals Yard and many more places



This is a FREE TOUR. IT IS NOT A FREE TOUR. A minimum of £10 per person is expected, completely decent, accessible and according to London prices, and in relation to the expenses that the guide must cover to carry out the tour. The local currency is THE POUND STERLING and it is the only currency valid and in circulation for all services and products in London, including our tours! We do not accept other currency. There is an option to pay by card or cash. There is a minimum for large groups
  • We will confirm your reservation through a WhatsApp message. If the number provided does not work, we will cancel the reservation for organizational reasons.

name: Jet Boating the Thames Barrier
shortDescription: Get ready for high speed thrills as a RIB boat propels you down the Thames all the way to the Flood Barrier and back!
description:
Get ready for high-speed thrills as a RIB boat propels you down the Thames all the way to the Flood Barrier and back!

Enjoy the works on the Thames RIB Experience’s longest ride. This mega 75 minute round trip from Embankment Pier delivers more hilarious commentary, unbelievable sights, and high-speed action than any other tour.

Embankment / Big Ben / Houses Of Parliament / MI5 / MI6 / London Eye / Cleopatra’s Needle / St Pauls Cathedral / Shakespeare’s Globe / Monument / The Shard / HMS Belfast / Tower Of London / Tower Bridge / Traitors Gate / Docklands / Canary Wharf / Greenwich / The O2 / Emirates Cable Cars and the amazing Thames Barrier (described as the 8th wonder of the world!). 

Perfect for sightseers who love a good adrenaline boost!

For approximately 2.5 - 3 hours you will discover the evolution of the most important music style in the United Kingdom, what every music lover cannot miss! :) Come with us to enjoy all these places: Oxford Street / Soho Square / Marquee Club / Savile Road / Carnaby Street / Berwick Street / 100 Club / Denmark Street / Punk Movement / The Beatles last concert / MOD Movement / Rock History in decades / Miranda Club / Shaftesbury Avenue / and much more! name: TOTAL London! -Free Tours (Available in Spanish)
description:
If you are coming to London for a few days and you don't know where to begin to explore this magnificent and at the same time gigantic city, this tour is for you!

It will be an incredible and very complete walk where those who have little time will take the most iconic.

From Trafalgar Square, considered the central point of London, we will cross the Admiralty Arch to give way to the ceremonial part of the Westminster district. Center of the monarchy and the nobility since its origins, our tour will visit aristocratic residences and royal palaces while we will tell you the story of the illustrious members of the English monarchy.

We will discover what changed the religious course of the country during one of the most renowned monarchies in English history and how this change encouraged the arrival of palaces and mansions in Westminster.

After strolling through one of the most beautiful royal parks in London, we will arrive at the center of power: Westminster Abbey, the Supreme Court of Justice and the Palace of Westminster, better known as Parliament with its internationally misnamed "Big Ben" tower. ”.

From there we will approach the River Thames for the first time, a marketing and navigation axis that will allow London to become a prosperous and cosmopolitan city since Roman times, to appreciate beautiful views, the famous London Eye and continue walking. until the lunch break.

We will resume the tour to go to the origins, where some curious dragons will welcome us to the City of London. Get ready to discover an area of architectural contrasts between the most modern and oldest buildings in the city.

From the Royal Courts of Justice, we will continue along Fleet Street, where we will begin to glimpse St. Paul's Cathedral with its emblematic dome. Then we will visit the center of power in The City, where the Bank of England and Mansion House are located, to continue the tour of contrasts with the Leadenhall Market and the skyscrapers of the financial center.

Thanks to the Monument of the Great Fire, we will discover the reason why London lost its medieval old town and how, thanks to its economic power, it managed to rebuild itself very quickly.

And at the end of our walk we will return to the river to be able to contemplate a unique and wonderful view of London Bridge, Tower Bridge and the Tower of London with its 1000 years of history!


We will explore together:

  •  trafalgar square
  •  Admiralty Arch
  •  Horse Guard Parade
  •  St James's Palace
  •  Buckingham Palace
  •  Saint James Park
  •  Westminster Abbey
  •  Palace of Westminster / Parliament "Big Ben"
  •  london eye
  •  Royal Courts of Justice
  •  San Pablo's cathedral
  •  Bank of England
  •  mansion-house
  •  The Royal Exchange
  •  Leadenhall Market
  •  Great Fire Monument
  •  london-bridge
  •  Tower of London
  •  Tower Bridge

Do not hesitate to book the tour whether you are visiting London for the first time or if you want to delve into the history of the city.

name: Harry Potter Free Walking Tour of London (Available in Spanish)
description:
Our adventure begins by going through a street that we will recognize at first sight , Diagón Alley , where every magician goes to do their shopping. There is the Quidditch shop, the Owl Emporium, the Flourish and Blotts bookstore, the mythical Ollivanders with the most requested magic wands of Hogwarts; and Honeydukes, the candy store with sprinkles of the most varied flavors.

Passing through Piccadilly Circus and Trafalgar Square we will remember some action scenes shot there, in which the Death Eaters attack Harry, Hermione and Ron several times throughout the story. And on the way to Whitehall we will discover what you have to do to enter the Ministry of Magic or how it is organized.
We will say goodbye to the magical Harry Potter Free Tour in London seeing Big Ben and Westminster Bridge , which appear in the "Order of the Phoenix" and in "The Prisoner of Azkaban".

One last recommendation to round off the afternoon? Ask our guide how to get to King's Cross Station to see Platform 9 and 3/4… Maybe the Hogwarts Express is waiting for you!

🧙‍♂️ Why choose us? 🧙‍♂️
During the activity we will play an interactive game where you will have the opportunity to show if you are a wizard or a muggle

name: Essential London Free Tour (Available in Spanish)
description:
On this walk we will visit the district of Westminster , a neighborhood in central London north of the Thames. We will see such famous monuments as Buckingham Palace , the official residence of Queen Elizabeth II, the Wellington Barracks and the famous Changing of the Guard (if it operates that day). We will also be surprised by the grandeur of Westminster Abbey , a favorite place for royalty to celebrate their ceremonies, and the Houses of Parliament , better known as the Palace of Westminster and recognized worldwide for its iconic Big Ben tower. In addition to dusting off the history books, the rich smell of Fortnum & Mason tea will invade our senses and we will have fun with the squirrels and pelicans of St. James's Park . We will also see the Anglican church built by Christopher Wren, the man who rebuilt London after the great fire of 1666; We will go through the red street The Mall and we will go to Downing Street , where the Prime Minister lives. Our Essential London Free Tour ends in Trafalgar Square , one of the most important squares in all of London.

Come and discover London with Paseando por Europa.

name: Changing Of The Guard - Free Walking Tour (Available in English)
description:
The Changing Of The Guards Ceremony at Buckingham Palace is iconic and seeing it up close is a once in a lifetime experience for many.

So why spoil it by having to stand for hours in the unpredictable British weather, amongst thousands of others, constantly fighting for the “best spot” only to discover  too late that your view is obstructed?

Take this FREE  (pay what you feel) walking tour with an expert guide who will take you to the “secret spots” (often hidden in plain sight) for unprecedented views of the ceremony. Much,smaller crowds, fewer or no barriers/fences or other obstructions, and an explanation of what is actual going on, so you can understand more of the traditions and pomp of the event as it unfolds in front of you.

GUARANTEED! to be within 10-15ft (3-4.5m) of the guards themselves, as they carry out this long standing tradition. Which traces its origins as far back as the late 17th century under the reign of William III and remains little changed since.

PLUS! this tour will also take you to the CHANGING OF THE HORSEGUARDS to see the mounted regiments of The Household Cavalry carry out their daily guard change and inspection. This is the best place in London to get that iconic photo with a guard in full regalia.

PLEASE NOTE: All or part of the ceremony may be cancelled, altered or otherwise changed by Buckingham Palace at any time, often at short notice and often without explanation especially in inclement weather. I will do my utmost to give all participants the best experience possible but due to logistics of the ceremony,  the planned route may change, I will endeavour to keep the group informed of any changes if and when they occur. 




The tour will also show you other famous London attractions and monuments such as:

  • Trafalgar Square
  • Nelsons Column
  • The National Gallery
  • Admiralty Arch
  • St James Palace
  • Buckingham Palace 
  • Clarence House
  • Horseguards Parade
  • The Banqueting House
  • Downing Street 

And more…


✍⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
“The walking tour with our guide Richard was G R E A T! We got to see the changing of the guard with great views! He really knew where we needed to be without a crowd in the way. We got great pictures and videos because of him! “

“Richard is such a good guide! We saw all the interesstings thinks very close! Highy recommend to do a tour with him!” - Petra - Austria

“Could not have been any more pleased with the quality of this tour. We never could have produced the same experience had we chose to do this on our own. This was stress-free, extremely informative, and super enjoyable.” - Brennan & Amy - Nashville


“best choice ever! Richard is witty, so be prepared for a fun tour! Highly recommended!”  Millie - Munich

These are just a couple of reviews from the thousands of happy visitors to London that I have had the pleasure of guiding over the past 20 years.

But don’t just take their word for it come and experience it yourselves.



📃THE BASICS📃- What you need to know! (And the boring legal bit)
📍The Tour Starts in Trafalger Sqaure (Nearest underground Charing Cross/Leicester Square) please meet at the top of the steps in the north east corner underneath the statue of George IV on horseback. Please note that there may be several tour groups  here so make sure you find the right one.  I will be wearing a flat cap and carrying a green bag.

📍The tour ends at Horseguards which is around 7 minute walk back to the start point, but also a similar distance from Parliament Square for Churchill War Rooms, Westminster Abbey, “Big Ben” The London Eye, The  River Thames and Westminster Station

🧑‍🦽The route is flat on either paved roads with one small set of steps, (currently unavoidable due to construction work on the step free route) Some sections on a gravel path/courtyard. The route is suitable for those with reduced mobility, however please be aware that at certain parts of the tour the group may need to move quickly to another location in order to secure a suitable vantage point for the next part of the ceremony. A comfortable pair of shoes or trainers is sufficient,  no need for any specific footwear, although it is advised against wearing high heels (sorry Gentleman!!!)

🐕‍🦺The tour is suitable for dogs but they MUST be kept on a lead at all times.

🥤🥪Please note that there are very limited Toilet facilities or refreshments on this tour (there are public toilets and a several cafes at the start point) You may eat and drink on the tour (please no alcohol) but please be responsible and take any rubbish with you until you can find a bin. Smoking and vaping is forbidden on this tour for the comfort of all participants.

👉Please be aware that the ceremony is on selected days only and can be cancelled, amended or rearranged at short notice for any number of reasons, particularly inclement weather conditions. Currently many cancellations and changes due to preparations for King Charles III Coronation in May.


👉💉I am Covid 19 vaccinated to the current UK government guidelines I  am also fully 1st aid qualified and hold an advanced DBS (child and vulnerable peoples) certification.

👉Also please note that the tour will come across wild animals including many wild birds and waterfowl, as well as horses and other animals. I ask all visitors to exercise caution when around these animals and advise that all participants are responsible for their own safety at all times. This also includes crossing any roads or cycle paths.

👉Please follow any instructions given to you by myself, police officers or any other person in an authoritative position whilst on the tour.

🎒Please take basic precautions with your personal belongings. All visitors are responsible for any personal possessions. Neither the guide or Guru Walks accept any liability for loss or damage to personal possessions or any personal injury or death whist taking part on the tour.

📩 If you have any questions please feel free to contact me via the tour guru website

I look forward to welcoming you to London

IMPORTANT INFORMATION REGARDING TOURS FOR MAY 2023 - Bookings for the tour are currently being accepted for April & May 2023, however due to the Coronation of King Charles III scheduled for Saturday 6th May, the guard change schedule and therefore the tour in and around this date, may be subject to change and or cancellation. Updates will be provided as soon as they have been confirmed by Buckingham Palace 

PLEASE NOTE : If a tour is unavailable it normally means that there is no guard change scheduled for that day. You can check the latest schedule here…

https://changing-guard.com/dates-buckingham-palace.html

However due to personal circumstances there is limited availability of this tour from 23rd July-1st September if a tour is showing as unavailable please look alternative dates if possible. If there is nothing available on dates that are convenient for you please check other providers.

name: The Monarchy: A History of Power - Free Walking Tour (Available in Spanish)
description:
An essential visit to start exploring London through the most emblematic monuments and stories! We invite you to tour the epicenter of monarchical, political and religious power: Westminster. Through the most famous and emblematic monuments of London, we will discover how it originates and the highlights of this history of power! We will start at Trafalgar Square to discover why it is considered as the central point of the city. We will cross the Admiralty Arch that will give way to the London ceremonial and monarchical area, being the best place to know the stories of the monarchy. We will discover what changed the religious direction of the country, and how the city was transformed until today. Whenever the official agenda allows, we will observe the changing of the guard and reveal the history and details of this ritual It is inevitable to talk about the British monarchy and not to go through Buckingham Palace, where we will explain its birth and its changes throughout history until it becomes the official residence of the monarch in London. And where there are royal palaces, there are beautiful parks! So we will take a walk through one of the eight royal parks and enjoy its lake, its fauna and its flora. We will end at the core of power: Westminster Abbey, the Supreme Court of Justice and the Palace of Westminster, better known as the Parliament with its internationally misnamed "Big Ben" tower. We will explore together: Trafalgar Square Admiralty Arch Horse Guard Parade Monument to King George VI and Queen Mother St James Palace Buckingham Palace St James Park Westminster Abbey Palace of Westminster, Parliament and "Big Ben"

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Spectacular Soho Tour: music, fashion and everything in between (Available in English)
description:
Want to know where Casanova once stayed in London? Or how Soho changed from a neighbourhood for the rich to a haven for the poor? Or perhaps you’re a music lover and you’ve always wanted to see where rock stars like the Beatles recorded their songs and the streets they partied on? Then this is the tour for you to learn everything you need (and want) to know about one of the liveliest neighbourhoods in the city

A neighbourhood with a history spanning back to the 17th century, I will guide you through these streets, telling you all about the history the buildings and the people who once lived there. From topics like music, sex, fashion, disease and the LGBT+ community, there’s nothing you won’t know about this vibrant community when the tour is done.

Some of the places we visit on my amazing tour: 

  • Soho Square 
  • John Snow Pub 
  • Carnaby Street 
  • Location of the recording studios where performers like Elton John and David Bowie recorded in. 
  • Venue where ‘Beatlemania’ was coined. 

And so much more...

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Harry Potter Tour (Available in English)
description:
Join your fellow wizards & witches and follow in the footsteps of your Hogwarts heroes on this Free Harry Potter Tour of London!

On this free walking tour of London you'll delve into wizarding London and discover the secrets behind J.K.Rowling's magical Harry Potter books.


You’ll visit the street that inspired Diagon Alley, get your photo taken with Hedwig at Knockturn Alley and find the historic London pub with close connections to the Leaky Cauldron.


Along the way you’ll get best Harry Potter photo opportunity at the Ministry of Magic, find the home of Harry Potter and the Cursed Child and discover one-of-a-kind Harry Potter memorabilia and real spell books!


With an enthusiastic Harry Potter tour guide, lots of Harry Potter trivia, secrets and games, this free Harry Potter tour of London is a truly magical way to visit London.


PLUS! At the end of our free Harry Potter tour you’ll receive an exclusive discount to purchase official Harry Potter souvenirs and memorabilia!



IMPORTANT #1 - Please only book a ticket for the adults joining the tour. Children are welcome but please do not book a ticket for them.
For example - if you are a group of 2 Adults & 3 Children then please only make your booking for 2 people.

IMPORTANT #2 - For the enjoyment of all customers, it will not be possible to accept a group of 8 or more people (including children).
This includes groups of more than 8 people thinking of booking through multiple bookings. 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: SOHO Free Tour, "Sex, Drugs and Rock and Roll" in the heart of London. (Not suitable for children under 14 years) (Available in Spanish)
description:
*Not recommended for children under 14 years of age.

!Done the law done the snare!


From the legalization of piracy to Paul Raymond, going through the transformation of the brothels of the old red light district.

SOHO represents the revolution of the modern era by reinventing the nude in theaters or giving the system a fight with the first communist manifesto.

  • We begin with the Opium War in Chinatown , going through the misadventures of the most womanizing English king at the origins of this old hunting ground. By the beginning of the 20th century, there was a mixture of restaurants of foreign origin, a fashionable place for intellectuals, writers, and artists.


  • We will pass by the famous Red Lion where Marx and Engels met to change the course of history.


  • We will tell the anecdotes of the famous Windmill Theater that opened a stage in Burlesque, dodging the censorship of the moment.


  • We will walk the streets of the most famous Gay neighborhood in the world remembering the King of SOHO, Paul Raymond, through the clubs that are still open.


  • We will talk about the rise of Sex Shops to the decline of Night Clubs, in an area that survived one of the toughest cholera pandemics, thanks to Dr. John Snow.


  • Rolling Stones or Jimi Hendrix will accompany us on this adventure in the heart of London, through the streets of the famous Carnaby Street, a symbol of the 70s .


  • We will finish in the temple that launched the acclaimed Beatles to fame: The Palladium Theatre, very close to Oxford Circus , where we will put the icing on the cake of our Tour.


If you dare, we can working OUT !!

Payment methods:

Cash or card.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Harry Potter Tour (Available in English)
description:
If you're still waiting for your letter from Hogwarts then despair no more!

Join our Potter potty guide and explore the London filming locations as seen in the movies as well as visiting a few of the real places in London that inspired J K Rowling to create this magical world.

Take a stroll down Charing Cross Road, (complete with real spell books), visit the entrances to the Ministry, and get insider tips on where to buy the best wands and Harry Potter goodies in London.

Oh and you will be tested on your Harry Potter knowledge in our Hogwarts Trivia House Cup, so get revising! 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free fun Tour of Westminster with packed places of interest (Available in English)
description:
Starting at Charing Cross we will walk around Trafalguar square to take pictures of Nelsons Column and the National Portrait Gallery. We will walk down the beautiful Mall towards Buckingham Palace to see the Queen. After we will continue our walk through St. James' Park taking in the tranquility and nature. From there we enter Westminster Square to see Westminster Abbey, the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben. We will cross over Westminster Bridge and walk along the Embankment past The London Eye for more photo opportunities. We will all cross the footbridge towards Embankment station while looking east down the river at various points of interest. From the north side of the river we will walk back towards Westminster past New Scotland Yard & Ministry of Defence Building for more photo opportunities of the London eye. We will then walk back up Whitehall past 10 Downing Street and outwards to Trafalgar Square and our starting point @ Charing Cross station.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free London Landmarks Tour (West) inc. Big Ben & Buckingham Palace (Available in English)
description:
Join this classic free walking tour of London and explore Westminster to get up close to many of the top London attractions.

On this free walking tour of London you'll discover the incredible true story of Buckingham Palace, admire the iconic Big Ben and step into the heartland of British government at the Houses of Parliament. 


You’ll relive the Royal weddings, coronations and funerals at Westminster Abbey (including the wedding of Prince William & Kate Middleton and the funeral of Queen Elizabeth II), find the home of the Prime Minister at Downing Street and stand in the centre of London in the historic Trafalgar Square. 


As you make your way through London you’ll walk down the Royal driveway of The Mall, discover the incredible St James’s Palace and see many more of the best London sights including the London Eye, The Cenotaph, Pall Mall, The National Gallery and Horseguards Parade - home of the Royal ceremonies!


With so many of the top London attractions included, this classic free walking tour of London gives you the chance to enjoy the very best London sightseeing all on one of the best free tours in London.


IMPORTANT #1 - Please only book a ticket for the adults joining the tour. Children are welcome but please do not book a ticket for them.
For example - if you are a group of 2 Adults & 3 Children then please only make your booking for 2 people.

IMPORTANT #2 - For the enjoyment of all customers, it will not be possible to accept a group of 8 or more people (including children).
This includes groups of more than 8 people thinking of booking through multiple bookings.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: From London: Unescorted Day Trip to Paris
shortDescription: Discover Paris at your leisure with an unescorted day trip that covers the city's most beloved landmarks. Train tickets and public transportation information help ensure you get the most of this journey.
description:
Upon arrival at St. Pancras International station, check in and pickup your Paris travel pack, designed to help you make the most of your time. The pack includes Eurostar train tickets with reserved seating and a map of Paris with public transportation information.

See the city of lights from a new vantage point with a river cruise alone the Seine. Pass by the Eiffel Tower, the Lourve, and other landmarks.

See the Galeries Lafayette, located near the center of Paris and a short cab ride away from the Gare du Nord station. Explore an impressive selection of designer clothing, jewelry, and beauty products before concluding your trip.

name: Paris 1-Day Trip with Eurostar and Hop-On Hop-Off Bus
shortDescription: Enjoy an independent 1-day rail trip from London to Paris – including return tickets on Eurostar, a hop-on hop-off bus tour and time to explore the city.
description:
Meet your representative at St Pancras Station before boarding the Eurostar, where all you need to do is sit back and relax, arriving at Paris in just a couple of hours.

On arrival at Gare du Nord, the day is yours to enjoy. Board the hop-on hop-off tour bus of Paris and see this wonderful city and all of its historical must-see sights, including the Eiffel Tower, Champs-Élysées, the Arc de Triomphe, Place de la Concorde, Notre Dame and the Louvre.

Hop on and off at your leisure as you visit all of these wonderful landmarks. With plenty of time for shopping and sightseeing, you’ll get to visit the iconic sights of Paris at your own pace.

name: Paris: 1-Day Tour from London with Coach Tour & Cruise
shortDescription: Enjoy a fully escorted tour from London to Paris with an English-speaking guide, including return tickets on Eurostar, a luxury private coach tour, and a 1-hour sightseeing cruise of Paris.
description:
Meet your representative at St Pancras Station before boarding the Eurostar. Then, just sit back and relax, as you arrive into Paris in just a couple of hours for a day of sightseeing. On arrival at Paris Gare du Nord, you and your guide will board your luxury private coach and start your Parisian journey pointing out sites as you travel through the heart of Paris on your way to the Eiffel Tower.

Get your cameras at the ready as your first stop is the Eiffel Tower, where you’ll have time to get up close to this spectacular monument, take photographs and create amazing memories.

In the afternoon, embark on a spectacular, circular sightseeing cruise on the romantic River Seine. Meander through the heart of Paris whilst taking in the stunning panoramic views from your all-glass boat, including an open air observation deck and fascinating audio commentary. Disembark your cruise when you will then have free time to explore the area, and have some lunch (ask your host for recommendations).

Re-board your private coach for a panoramic sightseeing tour of Paris where you will take in the major landmarks including the Champs-Elysees, the Arc de Triomphe and the Place de la Concorde. Stop at the Louvre for a photo opportunity at the famous glass pyramids. Round off the day in the area of Montmartre where you will have time to visit Sacré-Cœur. Enjoy exploring this charming neighborhood after the end of the tour and have a drink in cafe or do a little souvenir shopping.

name: Paris: Lunch Cruise and Sightseeing Bus Tour from London
shortDescription: Explore Paris on this 1-day dining cruise and private bus tour from London with your knowledgeable guide to discover the secrets and charm of the city.
description:
Meet your tour guide at London St Pancras Station before boarding the Eurostar. Sit back and relax as you arrive into Paris in just a couple of hours for a full day of sightseeing. On arrival at Paris Gare du Nord board a luxury private coach and start your Parisian journey, spotting famous sites as you travel through the heart of Paris.

Get your cameras at the ready as the first stop is the Eiffel Tower, where you’ll have time to take photographs of this spectacular monument and create amazing memories.

Next, board your two-hour sightseeing and Champagne lunch cruise at the foot of the Eiffel Tower. Enjoy exceptional views of the city, with premium seating under the glass canopy, whilst savoring French cuisine accompanied by relaxing live music.

Re-board your private coach for a panoramic sightseeing tour of Paris where you will take in the major landmarks including the Champs-Elysees, the Arc de Triomphe and the Place de la Concorde. Stop at the Louvre for a photo opportunity at the famous glass pyramid. Drive through the Latin Quarter, disembark your coach and make your way to the Notre Dame Cathedral, widely considered as one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture. Inside the cathedral, admire the fantastic stained glass rose windows and flying buttresses, before some free time to enjoy Paris’s cafes or a little souvenir shopping.

After your free time at Notre Dame re-join the group to travel back to the Gare Du Nord in time for your Eurostar train service back to London.

name: Eiffel Tower Champagne Lunch and Paris Day Tour from London
shortDescription: Take a guided tour from London to Paris and back on the Eurostar. Enjoy a private coach tour, Seine cruise and Eiffel Tower Champagne lunch.
description:
Board the Eurostar at London’s St. Pancras Station for a 16-hour excursion to Paris and back. On arrival at Paris Gare du Nord, you and your host will board your luxury private coach and start your Parisian journey taking in major landmarks including the Champs-Elysees, the Arc de Triomphe, Notre Dame, Musee d’Orsay and Place de la Concorde.

At the Eiffel Tower enjoy breathtaking views of the city and head to the 58 Tour Eiffel restaurant for a 3-course Champagne lunch.

After lunch it’s time to see a different view of the capital as you take to the river on a one hour sightseeing cruise on the romantic River Seine. Meander through the heart of Paris taking in stunning panoramic views from your all-glass boat with an open air observation deck and a fascinating individual audio commentary.

Re-board your private coach for a panoramic sightseeing tour of Paris where you will take in the major landmarks including the Champs-Elysees, the Arc de Triomphe and the Place de la Concorde. Stop at the Louvre for a photo opportunity at the famous glass pyramids. The final stop will be will be in the area of Montmartre & Sacré-Cœur where you will have time to visit Sacré-Cœur and maybe enjoy a drink in cafe or a little souvenir shopping.

After your free time at Notre Dame re-join the group to make your way back to the Gare Du Nord to ensure that you are on time to check in for your Eurostar train service back to London.
